content:
TITLE: Creating a Custom Content Loader in React
DESCRIPTION: This example illustrates how to create a custom content loader using the ContentLoader component. It demonstrates setting custom dimensions, colors, and SVG shapes to create a unique loading interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
const MyLoader = () => (
  <ContentLoader
    height={140}
    speed={1}
    backgroundColor={'#333'}
    foregroundColor={'#999'}
    viewBox="0 0 380 70"
  >
    {/* Only SVG shapes */}
    <rect x="0" y="0" rx="5" ry="5" width="70" height="70" />
    <rect x="80" y="17" rx="4" ry="4" width="300" height="13" />
    <rect x="80" y="40" rx="3" ry="3" width="250" height="10" />
  </ContentLoader>
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Custom Content Loader
DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a custom content loader with specific SVG shapes and dimensions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
const MyLoader = () => (
  <ContentLoader viewBox="0 0 380 70">
    {/* Only SVG shapes */}    
    <rect x="0" y="0" rx="5" ry="5" width="70" height="70" />
    <rect x="80" y="17" rx="4" ry="4" width="300" height="13" />
    <rect x="80" y="40" rx="3" ry="3" width="250" height="10" />
  </ContentLoader>
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Responsive Content Loader for Mobile in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a responsive content loader for mobile devices. It sets the width and height to 100, uses a viewBox, and applies a style to make it responsive.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { Code } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyCodeLoader = () => (
  <Code
    width={100}
    height={100}
    viewBox="0 0 100 100"
    style={{ width: '100%' }}
  />
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using uniqueKey Prop for Server-Side Rendering in React Content Loader
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use the uniqueKey prop to ensure consistent rendering in server-side rendering scenarios or snapshot tests. It prevents random id generation mismatches.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { Facebook } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyFacebookLoader = () => <Facebook uniqueKey="my-random-value" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Custom React Native Loader
DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a custom content loader for React Native using SVG components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import ContentLoader, { Rect, Circle } from 'react-content-loader/native'

const MyLoader = () => (
  <ContentLoader viewBox="0 0 380 70">
    <Circle cx="30" cy="30" r="30" />
    <Rect x="80" y="17" rx="4" ry="4" width="300" height="13" />
    <Rect x="80" y="40" rx="3" ry="3" width="250" height="10" />
  </ContentLoader>
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Preset Content Loaders
DESCRIPTION: Example of using pre-built content loader components including the default and Facebook presets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import ContentLoader, { Facebook } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyLoader = () => <ContentLoader />
const MyFacebookLoader = () => <Facebook />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using React Native Preset Loaders
DESCRIPTION: Example of using pre-built content loader components in React Native.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import ContentLoader, { Facebook } from 'react-content-loader/native'

const MyLoader = () => <ContentLoader />
const MyFacebookLoader = () => <Facebook />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using Facebook Style Content Loader in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import and use the Facebook-style content loader component from react-content-loader. It creates a simple loader that mimics Facebook's loading UI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { Facebook } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyFacebookLoader = () => <Facebook />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using Instagram Style Content Loader in React
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to import and use the Instagram-style content loader component. It creates a loader that resembles Instagram's loading interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { Instagram } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyInstagramLoader = () => <Instagram />
```

TITLE: Importing and Using Code Style Content Loader in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to import and use the Code-style content loader component. It generates a loader that mimics the appearance of loading code blocks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { Code } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyCodeLoader = () => <Code />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using List Style Content Loader in React
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to import and use the List-style content loader component. It creates a loader that resembles a loading list interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { List } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyListLoader = () => <List />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using Bullet List Style Content Loader in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to import and use the Bullet List-style content loader component. It generates a loader that mimics a loading bullet list interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { BulletList } from 'react-content-loader'

const MyBulletListLoader = () => <BulletList />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Content Loader - NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install react-content-loader using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm i react-content-loader --save
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Content Loader - Yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install react-content-loader using yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn add react-content-loader
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Native Dependencies - NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install react-content-loader and its React Native dependencies using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm i react-content-loader react-native-svg --save
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Native Dependencies - Yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install react-content-loader and its React Native dependencies using yarn.
SOURCE: https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn add react-content-loader react-native-svg
```
